Merge Domain data with subject-level data.

Source: R/util-MergeSubjects.R
MergeSubjects.Rd

MergeSubjects is a helper function used within mapping functions to join subject-level data with domain-level data, with the ability to impute zeros when necessary.

MergeSubjects(
  dfDomain,
  dfSUBJ,
  strIDCol = "SubjectID",
  vFillZero = NULL,
  vRemoval = NULL,
  bQuiet = TRUE
)

Arguments

dfDomain

data.frame Subject-level domain data containing one record per participant.

dfSUBJ

data.frame Subject level data often using ADSL-like data. Should include one record per participant for each participant included in the analysis population (all other participants should be dropped before calling mergeSubjects)

strIDCol

character Vector of length 1. The name of ID Column - Default: SubjectID

vFillZero

vector Column names from dfDomain to fill with zeros when no matching row is found for an ID in dfSUBJ.

vRemoval

vector Column names from dfDomain or dfSUBJ to check for zeros or NA for rows to be removed for non-meaningful records.

bQuiet

logical Suppress warning messages? Default: TRUE

Value

data.frame with one record per ID variable specified in the strIDCol parameter.

Details

Examples

MergeSubjects(
  dfDomain = clindata::rawplus_consent,
  dfSUBJ = clindata::rawplus_dm,
  strIDCol = "subjid"
)
#> # A tibble: 1,301 × 51
